intro: Adenocarpus wolgensis, commonly known as the African burr, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by spiny, three-lobed fruits that contain seeds. Adenocarpus wolgensis is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It plays a role in local ecosystems and has been used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities.
